column5: Last weekend was a "hot" bite......I'm on the far east shore below the River...the eyes were chasing the minnows like crazy onto the gravel beds and shallows just after dark. Off my dock I landed and released 15 eyes in one night- all in the 2- 2 1/2lb range (kept 2 for the pan). The hot lure was a jointed rapala in silver/red...3"..... Unfortunately I hooked/landed a 44" musky that night also.....I had a hard time reviving as it was a catastrophe trying to unhook and release it...... Don't know if it made it, but can only hope..... Fishing should be good this weekend also as the shiners are still pressing into the shallow water...

sounds like you have a great spot there I have been meaning to get there again, but the last time I was there was at the height of the great carp die off...  but I will get my boat in there this year thanks for the report
Good to hear, thanks for the report...
Nice story!  Has anyone ever mentioned to you that we like pics?

beauty post, good to hear the eyes are still around .. Iv been launching my boat at view lake and fishing around there (not far from you) .. havnt had nearly as much luck as you tho, hopefuly that will change !
Good job ScugogBoy You certainly have yourself a hot spot for eyes on your dock Thanks for sharing Leechman
